ygData.subject: RE: spells question
ygData.msgSnippet: Problem with Wave of Fear is that it is AE from the caster out (like the Word of Pain series). While Inspire Fear can be cast at a much greater distance on a
ygData.messageBody:
Problem with Wave of Fear is that it is AE from the caster out (like the
Word of Pain series). While Inspire Fear can be cast at a much greater
distance on a single target. Just depends on what you want to do. Other than
that the only difference is 10 mana points. I rely upon Inspire Fear when I
get in over my head when soloing.

Drizben D'Vorn
Defiled High Priest of Innoruuk
Oblivion Knight of the 30th Circle


> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
> I just made 24, and just bought my spells
> greater healing
> bravery
> wave of fear
> counteract poison
> symbol of Ryltan (and 20 bloodstones)
> dismiss undead
>
> I didn't buy hammer of striking (what a joke), and I didn't buy
> instill fear. Reason being I never used fear. But my question is:
> Is instill fear worth buying? Is there some marvelous tactic using
> the fear spells that I'm not familiar with? I figured wave of fear
> would be really, really handy, but instill fear was kind of worthless
> compared to it, if I understand them correctly. Can someone shed
> some light?
>
> Ergo Soulhealer
> 24th level cleric of Tunare
> test server
>
